The term David and Goliath is most often used as a reference for a single person taking on a corporation or government, but this is telling the original story from history about a real battle. The once-mighty King Saul falls victim to his own pride, as an outcast shepherd boy, David is anointed as the second king. This depicts Goliath as an actual giant. Newcomer Michael Iskander, who they cast after months of searching (also seen in Kimberly Akimbo on Broadway), stars as David; along with Ali Suliman as King Saul, Ayelet Zurer as Queen Ahinoam, Stephen Lang as Samuel, Indy Lewis as Mychal, and Martyn Ford as Goliath. Can one stone change the course of history? I guess it can. Even as a religious series, this looks properly entertaining. Also seems like it's borrowing from Count of Monte Cristo. Here's the second official trailer for Prime Video's epic series House of David, direct from PV's YouTube: You can watch the first official trailer for Prime Video's House of David series right here for the first look. House of David tells the story of the ascent of the biblical figure, David, who eventually becomes the most renowned and celebrated king of Israel. The series follows the once-mighty King Saul as he falls victim to his own pride. At the direction of God, the prophet Samuel anoints an unlikely teenager as the new king. As Saul loses his power over his kingdom, David finds himself on a journey to discover & fulfill his destiny, navigating love, loss, and violence in the court of the very man he’s destined to replace. As one leader falls, another must rise. House of David a series created by Jon Erwin (of Jesus Revolution), based on his idea from the original biblical story in 1 Samuel 17. The series is written and directed by Jon Erwin and Jon Gunn (director of the films Mercy Streets, My Date with Drew, Like Dandelion Dust, The Week, The Case for Christ, Ordinary Angels). With additional writing by Trey Callaway and Jonathan Walker. Made by Wonder Project, Amazon MGM Studios, Nomadic Pictures, Argonauts, Kingdom Story Company, and Lionsgate TV. Executive produced by Jon Erwin, Jon Gunn, Jonathan Lloyd Walker, Justin Rosenblatt, Chad Oakes, Mike Frislev. Amazon debuts House of David streaming on Prime Video starting February 27th, 2025. Source: YouTube

"David - you have the heart of a lion. What do lions do? They roar!" So let David roar! Prime Video has debuted a second official trailer for the series House of David, based on the biblical story that many are familiar with already. This epic series streaming later this week brings the iconic David vs. Goliath story (from the Book of Samuel) to the screen. The term David and Goliath is most often used as a reference for a single person taking on a corporation or government, but this is telling the original story from history about a real battle. The once-mighty King Saul falls victim to his own pride, as an outcast shepherd boy, David is anointed as the second king. This depicts Goliath as an actual giant. Newcomer Michael Iskander, who they cast after months of searching (also seen in Kimberly Akimbo on Broadway), stars as David; along with Ali Suliman as King Saul, Ayelet Zurer as Queen Ahinoam, Stephen Lang as Samuel, Indy Lewis as Mychal, and Martyn Ford as Goliath. Can one stone change the course of history? I guess it can. Even as a religious series, this looks properly entertaining. Also seems like it's borrowing from Count of Monte Cristo.

Here's the second official trailer for Prime Video's epic series House of David, direct from PV's YouTube:

You can watch the first official trailer for Prime Video's House of David series right here for the first look.

House of David tells the story of the ascent of the biblical figure, David, who eventually becomes the most renowned and celebrated king of Israel. The series follows the once-mighty King Saul as he falls victim to his own pride. At the direction of God, the prophet Samuel anoints an unlikely teenager as the new king. As Saul loses his power over his kingdom, David finds himself on a journey to discover & fulfill his destiny, navigating love, loss, and violence in the court of the very man he’s destined to replace. As one leader falls, another must rise. House of David a series created by Jon Erwin (of Jesus Revolution), based on his idea from the original biblical story in 1 Samuel 17. The series is written and directed by Jon Erwin and Jon Gunn (director of the films Mercy Streets, My Date with Drew, Like Dandelion Dust, The Week, The Case for Christ, Ordinary Angels). With additional writing by Trey Callaway and Jonathan Walker. Made by Wonder Project, Amazon MGM Studios, Nomadic Pictures, Argonauts, Kingdom Story Company, and Lionsgate TV. Executive produced by Jon Erwin, Jon Gunn, Jonathan Lloyd Walker, Justin Rosenblatt, Chad Oakes, Mike Frislev. Amazon debuts House of David streaming on Prime Video starting February 27th, 2025.
